title: Japan's national security strategy brought into question
description: Japan's alignment with US security strategy in Asia is being disputed by international relations experts.

title: Guatemala: French family, including a six-year-old, missing in jungle
description: Search is underway for the four tourists who were last seen on Wednesday in the Tikal National Park.

title: Robbie Robertson, founder of 'The Band' and road companion of Bob Dylan
description: With his band, the guitarist crafted albums that left a significant impact on his peers during the 1960s, eventually forging an unbreakable connection with Martin Scorsese.

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried jailed over witness tampering
description: Bankman-Fried, 31, has pleaded not guilty to charges of wire fraud and conspiracy to commit money laundering, as well as election finance violations, in connection with the spectacular collapse of his cryptocurrency firm.

title: Niger: ECOWAS determined to maintain pressure on junta
description: Meeting in Nigeria, the countries of the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) ordered the deployment of military force against the Niger coup leaders, while reiterating calls for a peaceful outcome.

title: In India, Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi clash over ethnic violence in Manipur
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has spoken out for the first time on the armed clashes that have shaken the country's north-east for over three months and in which more than 150 people have been killed.

title: Firefighters battle Maui blazes as death toll hits 55
description: Wildfires have ravaged the Hawaiian island, killing at least 55 people. The governor has warned that the death toll would likely rise as search and rescue operations continue.

title: Stéphane Tidet's 'Le Refuge,' a cabin drenched in a torrential downpour
description: 'The Art of Rain' (Part 6). The artist has created an installation in which everything drips, an allegory of a reality that we can no longer trust.

title: Mali Football Federation president detained
description: Mamoutou Touré, known as 'Bavieux,' was detained in Bamako on August 9, 2023, suspected of corruption.

title: X (formerly Twitter) is sued for discrimination
description: Seven former employees have accused the social media company of specifically targeting women in its redundancy plans following the takeover by Elon Musk in fall 2022.

title: French court temporarily suspends dissolution of climate activist group Soulèvements de la Terre
description: It was dissolved on June 21, with the government denouncing the 'use of violence' by its members. This suspension is only temporary, as the country's highest administrative court has yet to rule on the merits of the case.

title: Heatwaves: The economic cost of climate inaction
description: A study by Allianz estimates the economic loss caused by heatwaves over the last three months at 0.6% of the world's gross domestic product.

title: Involuntary manslaughter investigation opens for deadly fire at home for disabled adult
description: A Paris prosecutor has begun a preliminary investigation into a fire in northeastern France that resulted in the deaths of 11 people.

title: In Guatemala's dry corridor, 'without help, we wouldn't be able to eat'
description: In this 1,600-kilometer-long strip of land hit by extreme weather phenomena, some 10 million people live in very difficult conditions. The country has the world's sixth-highest rate of child malnutrition, which rose by almost 40% in 2022.

title: Against a backdrop of war, Locarno celebrates filmmakers' aesthetic audacity
description: From Romanian Radu Jude's collage-like film to Iranian Ali Ahmadzadeh's hypnotic work, a new aesthetic trend runs through the Swiss festival.

title: Women's World Cup: Sweden ends Japanese run and secures their place in semifinals
description: Amanda Ilestadt and Filippa Angeldal scored the winning goals and are now set to face Spain on Tuesday, August 15.

title: In Treblinka, the gas chambers of the Nazi extermination camp are being uncovered
description: Recent excavations have revealed the gas chambers of the Nazi extermination camp at Treblinka, east of Warsaw, where almost 900,000 people, almost all of them Jews, were gassed between 1942 and 1943.

title: 'We're getting ready for the big battle': Ukrainian soldiers' difficult Bakhmut counter-offensive
description: In the city that was conquered by the Wagner Group before the summer, the regular Russian army has taken over. Kyiv's forces are trying to regain ground, but they face 'highly motivated' opponents.

title: In Brazil, Lula faces growing pressure from the Landless Workers' Movement
description: The country's largest mass organization, representing 500,000 farming families, is calling on the left-wing president – who it has traditionally backed – to keep his promises on agrarian reform.

title: In and out of love: 'Our relationship was secret at work and that made for some comical situations'
description: Two days in the life of lovers: The first when there is everything to play for, and the last when everything is lost. This week, Charles, 44, talks about how he let a relationship fizzle out and how much he regrets it.

title: Riad Salameh, former head of Lebanon's central bank, hit with US sanctions
description: The former central bank governor is accused of enriching himself through corruption, even as his country's economic crisis deepened.

title: Doctors in England stage a fresh strike for pay restoration
description: The four-day strike by junior doctors – who represent half of doctors in UK hospitals – will begin on Friday, August 11, and finish on August 15.

title: Syria: Gunmen ambush a military bus in Syria's east, killing 20 soldiers
description: The attack was believed to be carried out by members of the Islamic State group, who still have sleeper cells across Syria despite their defeat in 2019.

title: China, Russia and Iran are engaged in foreign interference in New Zealand, intelligence agency reports
description: In a threat assessment report made public by New Zealand's domestic intelligence agency, China, Iran and Russia are accused of interference and disinformation.

title: Women's World Cup: Extra-time goal gives Spain a win over the Dutch and a semifinal spot
description: Salma Paralluelo and Mariona Caldentey scored the goals necessary to take Spain to their maiden semifinal place, and they will now face Japan or Sweden on Tuesday.

title: The history behind women's struggle to get their first World Cup
description: FIFA organized the first Women's World Cup in 1991, 61 years after the men's tournament was launched. Before that, women had no choice but to compete in unofficial competitions.

title: French conservatives' risky pitch: Le Pen's ideas, but more competent
description: The right-wing Les Républicains party, which has been in the opposition since 2012, likes to point out it has a history of governing the country, in the hope of undermining the far-right Rassemblement National's credibility.

title: Covid-19 makes a summer comeback amidst new variant concern
description: SARS-CoV-2 is causing a slight uptick in cases and emergency room visits in many regions throughout France. The emergence of the EG.5.1 variant, close to XBB and now dominant in France, raises questions about the relevance of current bivalent vaccines.

title: Son of Russian kamikaze drone developer works in disarmament at the United Nations
description: In Geneva, Lavrentii Zakharov, son of 'the new Kalashnikov' Alexander Zakharov, was recruited for a six-month internship by the United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research.

title: Hawaii: Death toll from wildfire devastation surges to 53, expected to rise higher
description: The fire marks the deadliest US wildfire since the 2018 Camp Fire in California, which killed at least 85 people and laid waste to the town of Paradise.
